p: As has been reported in both developed and poor countries [ 1, 23– 32], a univariate significant association exists between HM and HIV for patients both taking and not taking antiretroviral therapy. In sub–Saharan Africa, including DR Congo, HIV infection (well established as an oxidative stress condition [ 15]), the Epstein–Bar virus (EBV), the Kaposi sarcoma–associated herpes virus (KSHV), and malaria (a condition of endothelial dysfunction, a risk factor of HM oxidative stress [ 32]) are all identified as significant ecological risk factors of HM [ 1, 33– 37].
